- Inteli Team
- 29 Nov 2025
- Inteli Team
- 29 Nov 2025
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI

content_blocks.text: Artificial intelligence is no longer an isolated resource within companies. It is redesigning processes, changing skills and restructuring entire sectors. But despite all the technical sophistication, the big challenge for AI in Brazil is not technology, it's leadership.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI

content_blocks.text: And this difference has become even clearer with the findings of theArtificial Intelligence Jobs Barometer 2025by PwC.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI

content_blocks.text: 1. AI is valuing professionals and accelerating productivity, but only where there is prepared leadership
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 1. AI is valuing professionals and accelerating productivity, but only where there is prepared leadership

content_blocks.text: The Barometer provides some compelling data: the sectors most exposed to AI show three times greater growth in revenue per employee. In other words, when AI is used well, companies don't replace people, they empower people. The report also shows that:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 1. AI is valuing professionals and accelerating productivity, but only where there is prepared leadership

content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 1. AI is valuing professionals and accelerating productivity, but only where there is prepared leadership

content_blocks.text: But the authors themselves warn: real gains do not appear in organizations that apply AI "technically", without a strategy. Thiago Gon√ßalves, Inteli's Product Manager, highlights:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 1. AI is valuing professionals and accelerating productivity, but only where there is prepared leadership

content_blocks.text: Ambidextrous professionals are in great demand on the market today. These professionals are fluent in both business and technology. Knowing artificial intelligence or management in isolation doesn't deliver the expected results.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 1. AI is valuing professionals and accelerating productivity, but only where there is prepared leadership

content_blocks.text: 2. Brazil collects a lot of data, but turns it into little result
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 2. Brazil collects a lot of data, but turns it into little result

content_blocks.text: Most Brazilian companies are already surrounded by data: customer behavior, operational performance, payment histories, efficiency indicators.But the Barometer points out that much of this potential is not converted into value, because there is a lack of leadership capable of connecting technology and business. Thiago adds:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 2. Brazil collects a lot of data, but turns it into little result

content_blocks.text: We have often heard from executives of large companies here at Inteli that learning to deal with data to support decisions based on concrete information is no longer a differentiator but an indispensable prerequisite for leadership positions.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 2. Brazil collects a lot of data, but turns it into little result

content_blocks.text: It is precisely this difference betweenknowing AIandleading with AIthat defines the future of competitiveness.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 2. Brazil collects a lot of data, but turns it into little result

content_blocks.text: 3. Knowing AI is about tools. Leading with AI is about decisions
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 3. Knowing AI is about tools. Leading with AI is about decisions

content_blocks.text: The PwC study reinforces that, although technical mastery is valuable, the competitive advantage comes from leadership:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 3. Knowing AI is about tools. Leading with AI is about decisions

content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 3. Knowing AI is about tools. Leading with AI is about decisions

content_blocks.text: Victor Machado, Inteli's Growth Manager, points out:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 3. Knowing AI is about tools. Leading with AI is about decisions

content_blocks.text: Around here we like to say that we train professionals who are able to debate ROI, Churn and LTV with the same skill and competence as they argue about generative AI, Machine Learning and Agents.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 3. Knowing AI is about tools. Leading with AI is about decisions

content_blocks.text: 4. Brazil's big risk is getting stuck in the 'eternal pilot' mode
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 4. Brazil's big risk is getting stuck in the 'eternal pilot' mode

content_blocks.text: The Barometer and other international studies (such as Gartner and McKinsey) show that companies around the world are facing "pilot purgatory", AI initiatives that don't scale, integrate or connect to strategy. In Brazil, this happens more often because:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 4. Brazil's big risk is getting stuck in the 'eternal pilot' mode

content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 4. Brazil's big risk is getting stuck in the 'eternal pilot' mode

content_blocks.text: Victor reinforces:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 4. Brazil's big risk is getting stuck in the 'eternal pilot' mode

content_blocks.text: Our teachers have not only theoretical knowledge, but also practical experience in businesses that already apply AI. The challenge of not only optimizing project efficiency but also understanding how to scale businesses is not trivial, but it is a necessary step for every leader in this new era.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 4. Brazil's big risk is getting stuck in the 'eternal pilot' mode

content_blocks.text: 5. The Inteli MBA is designed to train exactly this type of leader
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 5. The Inteli MBA is designed to train exactly this type of leader

content_blocks.text: TheMBA in AI and Data for Businesswas born from a simple observation: Brazil needs managers who know how to use AI to decide, prioritize, communicate, lead hybrid teams and scale solutions. It's not a technical MBA. It's an MBA for those who lead. The student learns:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 5. The Inteli MBA is designed to train exactly this type of leader

content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 5. The Inteli MBA is designed to train exactly this type of leader

content_blocks.text: All this in480 hours, 12 months, 100% PBL, with challenges based on real situations in Brazilian companies, logistics, churn, innovation, operational efficiency, AI scalability. Thiago describes the program like this:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 5. The Inteli MBA is designed to train exactly this type of leader

content_blocks.text: The MBA in AI and Data for Business is a complete program for professionals looking to develop skills in technology and business through a practical methodology connected to the current challenges of optimization and scale through generative AI. The hybrid format, with synchronous online classes and face-to-face meetings every 5 Saturdays, is ideal for those who hope to reconcile their work routine with the need to stay up-to-date and competitive.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 5. The Inteli MBA is designed to train exactly this type of leader

content_blocks.text: 6. Knowing AI puts you in the conversation
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 6. Knowing AI puts you in the conversation

content_blocks.text: Leading with AI puts you at the decision-making table. The Barometer is clear:
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 6. Knowing AI puts you in the conversation

content_blocks.text: AI is accelerating careers and valuing professionals, but especially those who can connect technology to real impact.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 6. Knowing AI puts you in the conversation

content_blocks.text: It is this critical, strategic and applied capacity that defines who will lead the next decade of Brazilian organizations. And it is this capacity that Inteli wants to develop.
content_blocks.section: The difference between knowing AI and knowing how to lead with AI
content_blocks.subsection: 6. Knowing AI puts you in the conversation
